DataElement.preferredDefinition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Vital Signs Domain Temperature Vital Signs Original Result Unit
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to vital sign._A measure of the average kinetic energy of a system of particles. Temperature may be quantified, in the context of thermodynamics, as the potential of one system to transfer thermal energy to another system until both systems reach a state of thermal equilibrium._The unit of measure for the original vital signs test result.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to vital sign.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to vital sign.

Property.preferredName: Temperature Vital Signs Original Result Unit
Property.preferredDefinition: A measure of the average kinetic energy of a system of particles. Temperature may be quantified, in the context of thermodynamics, as the potential of one system to transfer thermal energy to another system until both systems reach a state of thermal equilibrium.:The unit of measure for the original vital signs test result.

Concepts.definition: A measure of the average kinetic energy of a system of particles. Temperature may be quantified, in the context of thermodynamics, as the potential of one system to transfer thermal energy to another system until both systems reach a state of thermal equilibrium.
The unit of measure for the original vital signs test result.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8-23-18 Created as part of the CDISC mapping task; tt. 10.27.20 Released for reuse by CTEP CDE Harmonization. mc

ValueDomain.preferredName: CDISC SDTM Unit for Vital Sign Result Terminology Code
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Terminology codelist used with Unit for Vital Sign Result within the Clinical Data Interchange Standards Consortium Study Data Tabulation Model._A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of pressure equal to 0.001316 atmosphere and equal to the pressure indicated by one millimeter rise of mercury in a barometer at the Earth's surface.

Concepts.definition: A non-SI unit of pressure equal to 133,332 Pa or 1.316E10-3 standard atmosphere. Use of this unit is generally deprecated by ISO and IUPAC.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of temperature of the temperature scale designed so that the freezing point of water is 0 degrees and the boiling point is 100 degrees at standard atmospheric pressure. The current official definition of the Celsius sets 0.01 C to be at the triple point of water and a degree to be 1/273.16 of the difference in temperature between the triple point of water and absolute zero. One degree Celsius represents the same temperature difference as one Kelvin.

Concepts.definition: A unit of temperature of the temperature scale designed so that the freezing point of water is 0 degrees and the boiling point is 100 degrees at standard atmospheric pressure. The current official definition of the Celsius sets 0.01 C to be at the triple point of water and a degree to be 1/273.16 of the difference in temperature between the triple point of water and absolute zero. One degree Celsius represents the same temperature difference as one Kelvin.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.

Concepts.definition: A basic unit of length in the former CGS version of metric system, equal to one hundredth of a meter or approximately 0.393 700 787 inch.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The SI derived unit of frequency; equal to one oscillation per second.

Concepts.definition: A SI derived unit of frequency; equal to one oscillation (one cycle) per second.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch.

Concepts.definition: A metric unit of length equal to one thousandth of a meter (10E-3 meter) or approximately 0.03937 inch.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A basic SI unit of mass. It is defined as the mass of an international prototype in the form of a platinum-iridium cylinder kept at Sevres in France. A kilogram is equal to 1,000 grams and 2.204 622 6 pounds.

Concepts.definition: A basic SI unit of mass. It is defined as the mass of an international prototype in the form of a platinum-iridium cylinder kept at Sevres in France. A kilogram is equal to 1,000 grams and 2.204 622 6 pounds.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: 8-14-19 tt associated concept with EVS definition.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A traditional unit of length equal to 1/12 of a foot or 2.54 centimeters.

Concepts.definition: A traditional unit of length equal to 1/12 of a foot or 2.54 centimeters.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The traditional unit of mass. By international agreement, one avoirdupois pound is equal to exactly 0.453 592 37 kilogram, 16 ounces, or 1.215 28 troy pounds.

Concepts.definition: The traditional unit of mass. By international agreement, one avoirdupois pound is equal to exactly 0.453 592 37 kilogram, 16 ounces, or 1.215 28 troy pounds.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a kilogram. One gram equals approximately 15.432 grains or 0.035 273 966 ounce.

Concepts.definition: The metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a kilogram. One gram equals approximately 15.432 grains or 0.035 273 966 ounce.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of energy equal to one kilocalorie per day.

Concepts.definition: A unit of energy equal to one kilocalorie per day.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of pressure equal to 0.001316 atmosphere and equal to the pressure indicated by one centimeter rise of mercury in a barometer at the Earth's surface.

Concepts.definition: A unit of pressure equal to 0.001316 atmosphere and equal to the pressure indicated by one centimeter rise of mercury in a barometer at the Earth's surface.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of energy expenditure equal to the ratio of the metabolic rate during physical activity in comparison to a reference metabolic rate.

Concepts.definition: A unit of energy expenditure equal to the ratio of the metabolic rate during physical activity in comparison to a reference metabolic rate.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Percentage; a fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.

Concepts.definition: A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A SI unit of power equal to the power which in one second produces or transfers the energy of one joule. The unit is used in measurements of power emitted, transferred or received as radiation, sound waves, heat flow rate, and rate of energy transfer.

Concepts.definition: A SI unit of power equal to the power which in one second produces or transfers the energy of one joule. The unit is used in measurements of power emitted, transferred or received as radiation, sound waves, heat flow rate, and rate of energy transfer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.

Concepts.definition: Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of temperature of the temperature scale designed so that the freezing point of water is 32 degrees and the boiling point is 212 degrees, placing the boiling and melting points of water 180 degrees apart. One degree Fahrenheit is 5/9ths of a kelvin (or of a degree Celsius), and minus 40 degrees Fahrenheit is equal to minus 40 degrees Celsius.

Concepts.definition: A unit of temperature of the temperature scale designed so that the freezing point of water is 32 degrees and the boiling point is 212 degrees, placing the boiling and melting points of water 180 degrees apart. One degree Fahrenheit is 5/9ths of a kelvin (or of a degree Celsius), and minus 40 degrees Fahrenheit is equal to minus 40 degrees Celsius.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The number of breaths (inhalation and exhalation) taken per minute time.

Concepts.definition: The number of breaths (inhalation and exhalation) taken per minute time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The number of heartbeats measured per minute time.

Concepts.definition: The number of heartbeats measured per minute time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A SI derived unit of pressure equivalent to one newton per square meter or 10 bars or to 1.45x10E-4 pounds per square inch.

Concepts.definition: A SI derived unit of pressure equivalent to one newton per square meter or 10 bars or to 1.45x10E-4 pounds per square inch.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The SI derived unit of spread rate of a substance by mass, used also as a measure of area density.

Concepts.definition: The SI derived unit of spread rate of a substance by mass, used also as a measure of area density and as a dose calculation unit.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Square meter is the SI unit of area measurement equal to a square whose sides are one meter long. Square meter is equal to 10,000 square centimeters; 0.01 ares; 1.196 square yards; 10.76 square feet; 1550 square inches.

Concepts.definition: A SI unit of area measurement equal to a square whose sides are one meter long. Square meter is equal to 10,000 square centimeters; 0.01 are; 1.196 square yards; 10.76 square feet; 1550 square inches.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A basic unit of thermodynamic temperature, one of the seven base units of the International System of Units (Systeme International d'Unites, SI). It is 1/273.16th of the thermodynamic temperature of the triple point of water, This sets the size of the kelvin unit for temperature differences and defines the thermodynamic temperature of an equilibrium mixture of waters ice-liquid-vapor as 273.16 K, where 0 K is the lowest possible temperature ("absolute zero").

Concepts.definition: A basic unit of thermodynamic temperature, one of the seven base units of the International System of Units (Systeme International d'Unites, SI). It is 1/273.16th of the thermodynamic temperature of the triple point of water. This sets the size of the kelvin unit for temperature differences and defines the thermodynamic temperature of an equilibrium mixture of waters ice-liquid-vapor as 273.16 K, where 0 K is the lowest possible temperature ("absolute zero").

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The unit of linear measure in the metric system, one of the seven base units of the International System of Units (Systeme International d'Unites, SI). Meter is defined as the length of the path traveled by light in a vacuum during a time interval of 1/299 792 458 of a second and is equal to 1.093 61 yards.

Concepts.definition: A unit of linear measure in the metric system, one of the seven base units of the International System of Units (Systeme International d'Unites, SI). A meter is defined as the length of the path traveled by light in a vacuum during a time interval of 1/299 792 458 of a second and is equal to 1.093 61 yards.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.
